intro: Ruellia velutina, commonly known as velvet ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that give it a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, and prefers well-drained soil in partial shade. Ruellia velutina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
